com.intel.util

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.FileUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for handling basic file I/O operations.

    • Method Summary

      Creates an empty nomedia file if needed which prevents files in the directory from being indexed.

      Ensures that the provided path is valid in that if a directory is expected but a file exists at that path, then the file will be delete and vice-versa.

      • getFileNameWithoutExtension

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getFileNameWithoutExtension(@NonNull
                                                                    java.io.File file)
        Returns the file name without the extension, if any, or an empty String otherwise.
        Parameters:
        file - a file.
        Returns:
        the file name without the extension.

      • collectFiles

        public static void collectFiles(@NonNull
                                java.io.File file,
                                @NonNull
                                java.util.Collection<java.io.File> foundFiles,
                                boolean recursive)
        Recursively collect all files into a Collection starting at the provided root directory.
        Parameters:
        file - The root directory to start the search. If this is a file, then it is added to the list and this method immediately returns.
        foundFiles - A List instance which is populated with the files that are round.
        recursive - Whether or not subdirectories should also be searched.

      • collectFiles

        public static void collectFiles(@NonNull
                                java.io.File file,
                                @NonNull
                                java.util.Collection<java.io.File> foundFiles,
                                boolean recursive,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.regex.Pattern filePattern)
        Recursively finds files that matches the given pattern starting at the provided root directory.
        Parameters:
        file - The root directory to start the search. If this is a file, then it is added to the list and this method immediately returns.
        foundFiles - A List instance which is populated with the files that are round.
        recursive - Whether or not subdirectories should also be searched.
        filePattern - The compiled pattern to match the files against. Any files that match this pattern are added to the List.

      • getFileExtension

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(@NonNull
                                                         java.io.File file)
        Returns the file extension of a file, if any, or an empty String otherwise.
        Parameters:
        file - a file.
        Returns:
        the file extension.

      • ensureDirectoryExists

        @Slow(value=MILLISECONDS)
public static boolean ensureDirectoryExists(@NonNull
                                                                      java.io.File path,
                                                                      boolean isFile)
        Ensures that the directory is created or, if a file, ensures that the file's parent directories are created. If there is an existing file when a directory is expected or if there is an existing directory when a file is expected, then that existing file object will be deleted if possible. If it could not be deleted, then this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        path - The file or directory to create directories for.
        isFile - Whether or not the input path is a file or directory.
        Returns:
        True if the directories were created or if they already existed.

      • ensureValidPath

        @Slow(value=MILLISECONDS)
public static boolean ensureValidPath(@NonNull
                                                                java.io.File path,
                                                                boolean isFile)
        Ensures that the provided path is valid in that if a directory is expected but a file exists at that path, then the file will be delete and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to check.
        isFile - Whether or not this path is expected to be a file or directory.
        Returns:
        True if an existing invalid directory or file existed at the path but was successfully deleted. Also returns true if the path was clear.

      • hasExtension

        public static boolean hasExtension(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File file,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String... extensions)
        Determines if the given file has any of the provided extensions.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check.
        extensions - The extensions to check.
        Returns:
        True if the file has one of the extensions or if the extensions argument is null.

      • deleteDirectory

        @CheckResult
public static boolean deleteDirectory(@NonNull
                                                   java.io.File path)
        Recursively deletes all files in a directory including the directory itself. This will return false if there were files or directories that could not be deleted.
        Parameters:
        path - A File object pointing to the directory to be deleted.
        Returns:
        True if the directory and all sub-directories were successfully deleted.

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(@NonNull
                            java.io.File source,
                            @NonNull
                            java.io.File destination,
                            boolean preserveFileDate)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a file from the source to the destination. The necessary directories to the destination file will be created as needed. The destination file will be cleared if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        source - The source file to copy.
        destination - The destination file to copy to.
        preserveFileDate - Whether or not the modified date of the source file should be preserved in the destination file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the source file does not exist or an IO error occurred while copying the file.

      • copyStream

        public static void copyStream(java.io.InputStream input,
                              java.io.OutputStream output)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copies stream from input to output. Both streams are closed in this method!
        Parameters:
        input - source input stream
        output - target output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case anything goes wrong.

      • copyStreamWithoutClosing

        public static void copyStreamWithoutClosing(java.io.InputStream input,
                                            java.io.OutputStream output)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies stream from input to output. Both streams are not closed in this method!
        Parameters:
        input - source input stream
        output - target output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case anything goes wrong.

      • getRelativePath

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getRelativePath(@NonNull
                                                        java.io.File base,
                                                        @NonNull
                                                        java.io.File file)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Computes the path for a file relative to a given base, or fails if the only shared directory is the root and the absolute form is better. Recursive utility method to compute the path for a file relative to a given base. If files do not share a common root, this method will fail with an IOException.
        Parameters:
        base - Base path to be "subtracted" from a file's absolute path.
        file - The file for which we want to find out a relative path.
        Returns:
        String containing the relative path for the given file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if files do not share a common parent directory.

      • renameFile

        public static boolean renameFile(@Nullable
                                 java.lang.String source,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String target)
        Renames the source file to the target file. Overwrites the target file if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        source - The absolute path to the source file.
        target - The absolute path to the target file.
        Returns:
        True if the file was successfully renamed and false otherwise.

      • ensureNoMediaFileExists

        @Slow(value=MILLISECONDS)
public static void ensureNoMediaFileExists(@NonNull
                                                                     java.io.File path)
        Creates an empty nomedia file if needed which prevents files in the directory from being indexed.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to create the nomedia file.

      • sanitizePathString

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String sanitizePathString(@NonNull
                                                           java.lang.String string)
        Scrubs the path string using Amazon AWS guidelines and replaces any questionable characters with a hexadecimal representation.
        Returns:
        String with special characters replaced with hex representations.
